meanings.definition: A sail set above the royal on a square-rigged ship.
meanings.sent1: The majestic skysail fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the skysail to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the skysail for a rest.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high like a skysail in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The white skysail against the blue sky was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To set a skysail on a ship.
meanings.sent1: They skysail the ship before embarking on the journey.
meanings.sent2: He will skysail the vessel for the upcoming voyage.
meanings.sent3: The captain always forgets to skysail the ship in his dreams.
meanings.sent4: She skysailed through the waves with determination.
meanings.sent5: Skysailing the ship requires skill and precision.

meanings.definition: The highest sail on a mast.
meanings.sent1: The crew admired the towering skysail on the mast.
meanings.sent2: The storm threatened to tear the skysail apart.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey climbed to the top of the skysail for fun.
meanings.sent4: His ambition reached as high as the skysail on the mast.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the polished wood of the skysail.
